alert.note: Alert for Bell; Knox; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 25 at 5:23PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Bell, southwestern Knox and southeastern Whitley Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 523 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Dixie, or near Williamsburg, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Carpenter around 530 PM EDT. Siler, Goins and Birdseye around 535 PM EDT. Frakes, Pearl and Wilkerson around 540 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Chenoa, Fonde, Pruden, Davisburg, Middlesboro, Noetown and Binghamtown. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 1 and 10. U.S. Highway 25 East in Bell County between mile markers 1 and 5. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
